On another note, does Riot consider Kled a diver or a skirmisher? (My guess is diver.)
His ultimate screams Diver. Heck everything does from Voice lines to abilities names. Lol.

His ultimate actually is not very "diver" at all, considering it locks him onto the first target he sees, meaning he can't ignore frontlines the way many divers want to.

Kled is a skirmisher, through and through.
And this is why I wanted a Rioter to weigh in on the topic.  He has both diver and skirmisher aspects to his kit.

No, he has basically entirely skirmisher elements.

Divers and Skirmishers are very similar classes but there are two major points of differentiation - their mobility and their defenses.

Divers have powerful, cooldown gated mobility spells that either have huge reach (Vi Q, Irelia Q, Camille E) or insane reliability (Pantheon W, Xin Zhao E). These spells are designed to get Divers onto the enemy backline. Skirmishers on the other hand don't have mobility spells on basic abilities with such raw gapclosing power. They instead have mobility that is much more persistent and repeatable - mostly very low cooldown, short range dashes (Fiora Q, Yasuo E), with the noticable exception being Gangplank, who simply just gets lots of speedboosts. Kled's E falls directly in the latter category, being a very short range dash with an effective 3 second cooldown lategame (2 casts on a 6 second cooldown).

For defensive tools, Divers often have very simple, relatively low-power tools, if any at all. Skirmishers on the other hand have incredibly powerful defensive tools, but they are much more gated (Wind Wall 26 second cooldown), they are often expressions of skill (Grand Challenge), and they often scale with offensive stats or reward offensive play (Valor). Kled's remount is a perfect example of this - its an insanely powerful defensive tool, but its only going to ever happen once in a long while and Kled has to play risky to get it.

While those two are really the only important things when it comes to classifying him as a Skirmisher over a Diver, the rest of his kit also leans into a Skirmisher playstyle. All his skills have massive bonus AD ratios. The ways his W works prevents him from saving his damage for a priority target like a Diver would want to. His ult grants him a massive AD scaling shield.

His ultimate isn't intimately tied to being a Skirmisher, but ultimates don't define what class a champion belongs to, unless its on a basic ability cooldown like Kassadin or Corki. Ultimates give champions access to tools from outside their class and give them a reason to be picked over similar champions. Kled's ult gives him the unique distinction of being a Skirmisher with hard engage.

As a small reminder: Camille isn't an assassin. She's a fighter/bruiser.

She's SUPPOSED to build tanky with some AD. She's not a character you go in, get a kill then get out with. She's a character who goes in and stays in. She also doesn't boast the utility Ekko does. (Ekko had a giant AoE shield and a metric fuckton of slows vs. Camille's single knockback ult, her slow and repositioning knockback.)

To be fair, Ekko is intended to be an assassin while Cami is intended to be a diver like Irelia or Vi. One is suppose to build full damage & the other is suppose to build damage & defense. So it comes as no surprise if her most successful build has a number of tank items.

Frankly, I'm not really sure what's the point the PBE at all, considering how utterly broken a lot of the stuff coming out of it really is.
Okay, so Azir is a horror-story on how much of a nightmare something actually can turn out to be to get right here, but over, say, the last 20 champions released, how many was actually buffed on week 4-6 after their release?

I REALLY don't understand why even the so-called high-ranking, in-house playtesters can't see this even after so many occurrences.

Much like [Daxanater](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/BHBKKRzo-tank-camille-will-be-cancerous-af-im-calling-it-right-now?comment=0001) says, there is a pattern to find on this:
Week 1: 7800 IP / 975 RP (released broken, so as many as possible will - hopefully - spend money on it).
Week 2: 6300 IP / 975 RP.
Week 3: In free champion rotation (in the hopes of even more people unlocking - preferably buying - her).
Week 4-5: Nerfed.

Later: New skin with buffs.

Profit indeed.
